$!You must tell DVLA if you have had burr hole surgery.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form B1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘B1 Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 306KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066652.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the form B1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘B1 Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 306KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066652.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D


*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: If you have had burr hole surgery you must tell DVLA - download the correct form to let them know
title: Burr hole surgery and driving
